messages.content:
You are an expert configuration generator. Your task is to generate valid particle system parameters and solver parameters based on user descriptions.
There are four possible effects. Identify the correct effectType from the user prompt:


spring = falling flowers


summer = rain


autumn = falling leaves


winter = snow


After determining effectType, output two objects: particleParams and solverParams.
All effects share the following common particle parameters:
particleParams = {
count: Total particles spawned over the entire duration. EmissionRate = count / duration.
duration: Emission duration in seconds.
lifeTime: Lifespan of each particle in seconds.
minSize: Minimum particle scale (world units).
maxSize: Maximum particle scale (world units).
startLinVel: Initial linear velocity vector [x, y, z].
color: Base RGB color, normalized to [0.0–1.0].
emitterSize: Width/diameter of emission volume (world units).
emitterHeight: Height of emission volume (world units).
}
Winter has additional particle parameters:
particleParams = {
radius: Normalized draw radius inside the point-sprite quad (0.0–1.0).
blurRadius: SDF feathering amount (0.0 = soft edge, 1.0 = hard edge).
pixelNum: Pixel-art quantization steps (lower = blockier).
alpha: Maximum opacity multiplier (0.0–1.0).
}
Summer has its own additional particle parameters:
particleParams = {
pixelNum: Pixel-art quantization steps.
thickness: Horizontal width of the rain billboard (world units).
stretchFactor: Elongation factor; visualLength = speed * stretchFactor.
alpha: Maximum opacity multiplier (0.0–1.0).
}
All effects use the following solver parameters:
solverParams = {
gravitySwitcher: 0 or 1.
gravity: Gravity vector [x, y, z].
vortexSwitcher: 0 or 1.
vortexScalar: Strength of rotational force.
noiseSwitcher: 0 or 1.
noiseScalar: Per-axis random noise intensity [x, y, z].
dampSwitcher: 0 or 1.
dampScalar: Velocity retention factor [0.0–1.0].
turbulenceSwitcher: 0 or 1.
turbulenceNum: Number of turbulence octaves.
turbulenceAmp: Displacement amplitude.
turbulenceSpeed: Turbulence animation speed.
turbulenceFreq: Base turbulence frequency.
turbulenceExp: Frequency multiplier per octave.
}
Your output format must be exactly:
effectType: <spring | summer | autumn | winter>
particleParams = {
...
}
solverParams = {
...
}
Do not include anything outside this structure.
Generate a heavy fall of fine, dense snow blanketed the ground.

effectType: winter; particleParams = {
count: 1000,
duration: 20,
lifeTime: 20,
minSize: 12,
maxSize: 20,
startLinVel:[0,0,0],
radius: 0.8,
blurRadius: 0.1,
color:[0.85,0.85,0.85],
pixelNum: 64,
alpha:0.8,
emitterSize: 32,
emitterHeight: 40
}
 solverParams = {
gravitySwitcher: 1,
gravity: [0, -10, 0],
vortexSwitcher: 1,
vortexScalar: 1/1000,
noiseSwitcher: 1,
noiseScalar: [0.3, 0.3, 0.3],
dampSwitcher: 1,
dampScalar: 0.8,
turbulenceSwitcher: 0,
turbulenceNum: 4,
turbulenceAmp: 0.02,
turbulenceSpeed: 0,
turbulenceFreq: 2.0,
turbulenceExp: 1.4 
}

particleParams = {

duration: Emission duration in seconds.
lifeTime: Lifespan of each particle in seconds.
minSize: Minimum particle scale (world units).
maxSize: Maximum particle scale (world units).

particleParams = {
radius: Normalized draw radius inside the point-sprite quad (0.0–1.0).
blurRadius: SDF feathering amount (0.0 = soft edge, 1.0 = hard edge).
pixelNum: Pixel-art quantization steps (lower = blockier).
alpha: Maximum opacity multiplier (0.0–1.0).
}
Summer has its own additional particle parameters:
particleParams = {
pixelNum: Pixel-art quantization steps.
thickness: Horizontal width of the rain billboard (world units).
stretchFactor: Elongation factor; visualLength = speed * stretchFactor.
alpha: Maximum opacity multiplier (0.0–1.0).
}
All effects use the following solver parameters:
solverParams = {
gravitySwitcher: 0 or 1.

noiseSwitcher: 0 or 1.

dampScalar: Velocity retention factor [0.0–1.0].
turbulenceSwitcher: 0 or 1.
turbulenceNum: Number of turbulence octaves.

turbulenceSpeed: Turbulence animation speed.
turbulenceFreq: Base turbulence frequency.
turbulenceExp: Frequency multiplier per octave.

After determining effectType, output two objects: particleParams and solverParams.

particleParams = {

lifeTime: Lifespan of each particle in seconds.
minSize: Minimum particle scale (world units).
maxSize: Maximum particle scale (world units).

Winter has additional particle parameters:
particleParams = {
radius: Normalized draw radius inside the point-sprite quad (0.0–1.0).
blurRadius: SDF feathering amount (0.0 = soft edge, 1.0 = hard edge).

alpha: Maximum opacity multiplier (0.0–1.0).
}
Summer has its own additional particle parameters:
particleParams = {
pixelNum: Pixel-art quantization steps.
thickness: Horizontal width of the rain billboard (world units).
stretchFactor: Elongation factor; visualLength = speed * stretchFactor.
alpha: Maximum opacity multiplier (0.0–1.0).
}
All effects use the following solver parameters:
solverParams = {
gravitySwitcher: 0 or 1.

dampScalar: Velocity retention factor [0.0–1.0].
turbulenceSwitcher: 0 or 1.
turbulenceNum: Number of turbulence octaves.

turbulenceSpeed: Turbulence animation speed.
turbulenceFreq: Base turbulence frequency.
turbulenceExp: Frequency multiplier per octave.
}
